Detailed Description

Class used to enumerate items into containers. Hash and Vector produce Enumerations so that one can get all elements in a linear way.

Member Function Documentation

void uStreamLib::Enumeration::addElement (  void *  item,
uint32  size
) 
 

Add an element to the enumeration. You must specify the element to add (a pointer) and its size if any. This method make the enumeration grow accordingly with its previous size.

Parameters:
item an opaque pointer to the element to add.
size item's size if any.

Definition at line 124 of file enum.hpp.

bool uStreamLib::Enumeration::hasMoreElements (  void   )  [inline]
 

Call this method to check if enumeration has more elements. This method returns true if there are more elements to get. Get an element by using nextElement() method. You need to cast to your object for using that element.

Returns:
true or false.

Definition at line 62 of file enum.hpp.

int32 uStreamLib::Enumeration::init (  uint32  size  ) 
 

When implementing a storage class such as Hash and Vector or similar, you can create internal enumerations and then return them after having filled them with values. Enumeration has a size that grows dynamically by adding new elements.

Parameters:
enumeration size.

Definition at line 43 of file enum.cpp.

void * uStreamLib::Enumeration::nextElement (  uint32 *  item_size  ) 
 

This method is similar to nextElement(). By invoking this method you can retrieve next element and its size, by passing the address of a uint32 variable in which to store next element's size.

Parameters:
item_size output parameter for storing size.
Returns:
the next element as opaque pointer.

Definition at line 65 of file enum.cpp.

void* uStreamLib::Enumeration::nextElement (  void   )  [inline]
 

This method returns the next element in the enumeration if there is one available. Don't call this method if hasMoreElements() has returned false.

Returns:
a pointer to the next element. You need to cast.

Definition at line 72 of file enum.hpp.

void uStreamLib::Enumeration::rewind (  void   )  [inline]
 

Rewind the enumeration so that you can call hasMoreElements() and nextElement() again.
